intro: Gnidia lucens, commonly known as the yellow stinkwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are opposite and have a rough texture, while its bark is thick and fissured. Gnidia lucens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
